explosives.rationale: Containing no atom groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#2078)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no atom groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures; the flashing point is 620degC (ICSC, 2004)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available - melting point: 22degC (ICSC,2004), test temperature: 140degC

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#2078)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 5,800mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 6,170mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 2000) and 5,800mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2004).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the LC50 value (4 hours) of 897ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (6 hour inhalation of dust/mist) of 4.27mg/L (PATTY 4th, 2000), exceeded the saturated vapor concentration (660 ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 67 Pa (25degC) (CERI Hazard Data 97-20, 1998), the substance is likely to contain mist, despite its description as vapour.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description of "severe" found in the RTECS report (2005) on rabbit skin irritation tests, suggesting that the substance induces at least mild skin irritation, although it is unclear whether the tests were 4-hour tests, and based on the fact that the substance is classified as "Xi (irritant)"by EU Risk Phrase.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "severe irritation"in rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 97-20, 1998) and "slight conjunctival irritation" and "stinging in the eyes, lacrimation"in human eye irritation tests (DFGOT Vol. 20, 2005), although the substance should be placed in Category 2A from the viewpoint of safety.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Category 1 Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale:
Respiratory sensitization: due to the fact that the substance was classified as "Respiratory Tract Group 1" according to Recommendations by the Japan Society of Occupational Health (2005).
Skin sensitization: based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests (EHC 75, 1987) and due to the fact that the substance is classified as "Skin Group 2" according to Recommendations by the Japan Society of Occupational Health (2005) and "SEN" by ACGIH-TLV (2005).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Due to the lack of description on the type of cells (germ cells or somatic cells) used for in vivo tests in which positive results were obtained, although positive results were obtained for multiple indices in in vitro mutagenicity tests.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A4 by ACGIH (2001), Group 2B by IARC 71 (1999) and Category 2B according to Recommendations by the Japan Society of Occupational Health (2004), and priority was given to the IARC classification, following the guidelines.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on human evidence including "the substance induces eye/skin/respiratory irritation and induces chemical bronchitis, pneumonia and pulmonary edema through inhalation of vapor" (ICSC (J) (1995)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "reversible hyperplasia in the larynx, squamous metaplasia, rhinitis, forced breathing, reversible hyperplasia in the trachea, necrotizing bronchitis, bronchiolitis, hyperplasia in the lung, metaplasia, dropsy, alveolitis, decrease in urinary output and urine protein levels, increases in blood nitrogen, hemoglobin and hematocrit levels and red blood cell counts, decreases in platelet and while blood cell counts" (DFGOT Vol. 20, 2004). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 96 hours LC50=164500microg/L of the fish (Fathead minnows) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 1 (2002) and others.). In addition, methyl-1,3-phenylene diisocyanate (isomer mixture of this substance) was classified into Category 1.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was classified into Not classified (acute toxicity is not reported within the aqueous solubility concentrations) and the bio-accumulation was low (BCF=380 (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Not classified. In addition, the chronic toxicity of methyl-1,3-phenylene diisocyanate (isomer mixture of this substance) was classified into Category 1.
